alert.note: Alert for Northern Franklin; Northern St. Lawrence; Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Southwestern St. Lawrence; Western Clinton; Western Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 21 at 1:27PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Moderate to heavy rain or snow showers will impact portions of western Clinton, Franklin, St. Lawrence and western Essex Counties at least through 315 PM EST... At 120 PM EST, a line of moderate to heavy rain and snow showers is pushing through southern Canada and from off of Lake Ontario, moving east-northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds 30 mph or greater, and visibility less than a mile have occurred with this line. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Rapid lowering of visibility and a quick accumulation of snow may pose a hazard to motorists. Locations impacted include... Potsdam, Massena, Gouverneur, Saranac Lake, Canton, Tupper Lake, Adirondack Regional Airport, Ogdensburg, Lake Placid, Norfolk, Oswegatchie, Lisbon, Louisville, Moira, De Kalb, Bangor, Fowler, Parishville, Fort Covington and Colton. This includes Interstate 87 between mile markers 82 and 93, and near mile marker 95.
info.instruction: Conditions can deteriorate rapidly with this line of showers. Be prepared for snow covered roads where temperatures are near freezing. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.

area.areaDesc: Northern Franklin; Northern St. Lawrence; Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southern Franklin; Southwestern St. Lawrence; Western Clinton; Western Essex
